meanings.definition: A person who boos or expresses disapproval, especially at a sporting event.
meanings.sent1: The boobird in the crowd made their disapproval known loudly.
meanings.sent2: The fans were not happy with the referee's call, so they let out a chorus of boobirds.
meanings.sent3: The boobird at the game had a booming voice that echoed through the stadium.
meanings.sent4: The boobird perched high in the stands, casting a shadow of disapproval over the players.
meanings.sent5: The image of the boobird flapping its wings in protest stayed with the audience long after the game ended.

meanings.definition: To boo or express disapproval, especially at a sporting event.
meanings.sent1: The crowd began to boobird when the opposing team scored a goal.
meanings.sent2: It is not polite to boobird during a performance, as it can be discouraging to the performers.
meanings.sent3: The children thought it was funny to boobird at each other during the game, giggling uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The fans continued to boobird even after the match ended, showing their disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the crowd's boobirding reverberated across the stadium, creating a tense atmosphere.
